title: Barcelona will pay West Brom £215,500 in compensation after signing Louie Barry to their academy
text:
West Brom have finally received assurances that from Barcelona that they will stump up for teenager Louie Barry - three months after he quit the Baggies for the Nou Camp.

Barry, 16, scored on his youth-team debut for Barcelona as they defeated CD Ebro's Under-19 side 6-0 on Sunday.

The forward declined a contract offer from Albion to agree a three-year deal with Barcelona in July, meaning the Championship leaders are owed €250,000 (£215,500) in training compensation.

Barcelona have confirmed to West Brom that they'll pay them in compensation for Louie Barry

The 16-year-old signed for Barcelona after rejecting a professional contract with West Brom

Sportsmail understands West Brom have now had contact from Barcelona officials to acknowledge there is still money outstanding for Barry, who was also the subject of interest from Paris Saint-Germain last summer.

When he was signed, Barry became the first English player to be integrated into Barcelona's La Masia academy. He signed a three-year contract with the Catalan giants.

West Brom had offered Barry, from Sutton Coldfield near Birmingham, a three-year contract comprised of a one-year scholarship followed by a two-year professional deal when he turned 17.

Barry celebrates scoring his first goal for Barcelona's academy side on Sunday

The young Englishman scored Barcelona's fifth goal in a 6-0 thrashing of Ebro

Barry had endured a wait to make his Barcelona debut after signing from West Brom
